adjective.description: Without one's mental faculties, typically a result of violence or intoxication; unconscious.
examples: they knocked each other insensible with their fists
they slept on, insensible to the headlight beams

adjective.description: Too small or gradual to be perceived; inappreciable.

origin: Late Middle English (also in the senses unable to be perceived and incapable of physical sensation): partly from Old French insensible (from Latin insensibilis, from in- not + sensibilis, from sensus sense), partly from in- not + sensible.
